data.title: Benjamin Franklin Greenup (1859-1938)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Frank Greenup born 1859 Allamakee, Iowa, United States died 1938 Lucky Strike, Alberta, Canada including ancestors + descendants + 1 photos + 1 genealogist comments + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 27 Feb 2022 | Created 22 May 2013

This page has been accessed 433 times.

Biography

Benjamin Franklin Greenup was born December 4, 1859 in Iowa, USA. He was the tenth of eleven children of Stephen Greenup and Betsy Hoyt. [1][2]

Benjamin (AKA Frank) can be found on the 1860 US census for Lafayette Twp., Allamakee County, Iowa as an infant, along with his parents and brothers and sisters. The census was enumerated in June of 1860:

Name 'Sex Age Race Est. Birth yearBirthplace S H Greenup Male 39 White 1821 Kentucky Elizabeth A Greenup Female 39White 1821 New York Hester A Greenup Female 17White 1843 Illinois Julia E Greenup Female 15White 1845Illinois Edwin F Greenup Male 12 White 1848Iowa Jason L Greenup Male 11 White 1849Iowa Willert F Greenup Male 9 White 1851Iowa Lucy E Greenup Female 6White 1854Iowa William A Greenup Male 4 White 1856Iowa Albert E Greenup Male 2 White 1858Iowa Benjamin F Greenup Male 6/12 White 1860 Iowa

[3]

The 1870 census shows Frank at the age of 10, along with his family in Union Prairie Twp., Allamakee County, Iowa.

Name 'Sex Age Race Est. Birth yearBirthplace S W Greenup Male 49 White 1820-1821 Kentucky Elizabeth Greenup Female 49White 1820-1821 New York Julia Greenup Female 25White 1844-1845 Illinois Jason Greenup Male 21 White 1848-1849 Iowa Wilber Greenup Male 19 White 1850-1851 Iowa William Greenup Male 14 White 1855-1856 Iowa Albert Greenup Male 12 White 1857-1858 Iowa Benjamin Greenup Male 10 White 1859-1860 Iowa Edmond Greenup Male 3 White 1866-1867 Iowa

[4]

Frank Greenup can be found on the 1885 Minnesota State census in Township 133-134 Range 32, Cass, Minnesota at age 26 along with his wife "Elmery" (Elmira), age 19 (female), and their two children. There is also an 18 year old in the household named "Grant" Greenup. Frank's younger brother is named "Edmond Grant", so he may be the young man in their household. Edmond Grant was born Feb. 1867 [5]

Name 'Sex Age Race Est. Birth yearBirthplace Frank Greenup Male 26 White 1859 Iowa Elmery Greenup Female 19White 1866 Ohio Emma Greenup Female 2White 1883 Minnesota George Greenup Male 6 mos. White 1885 Minnesota Grant Greenup Male 18 White 1867 Iowa

[6]

Frank Greenup can be found on the 1900 US census for Barnes County, North Dakota with his much larger family. According to the census, Frank and Elmira had been married for 18 years. Elmira had given birth to 9 children, all of whom were alive when the census was taken.

NameSexAgeStatusRaceRoleBirth Birthpl Father b Mother b Frank Greenup Male 40 Marr White Head Dec 1860IowaMissouriKentucky Elmira Greenup Female 31 Marr White Wife Nov 1869OhioPenns Ohio May Greenup Female 17 SingWhite Dau. Mar 1883Minn IowaOhio Geo Greenup Male 16SingWhite Son Nov 1884Minn IowaOhio Benny Greenup Male 14SingWhite Son Aug 1886Minn IowaOhio Harry Greenup Male 12SingWhite Son Jul 1888Minn IowaOhio Clara Greenup Female 10SingWhite Dau. Oct 1890MinnIowaOhio Fannie Greenup Female 7SingWhite Dau. Feb 1893MinnIowaOhio Edith Greenup Female 5SingWhite Dau. May 1895N Dak IowaOhio Earnst Greenup Male 3SingWhite Son Mar 1897N DakIowaOhio Lucy Greenup Female 1SingWhite Dau. May 1899N DakIowaOhio

[7]

Benjamin ("Frank") Greenup can be found on the 1911 Canadian census in Medicine Hat, Alberta, Canada along with his second wife, Fanny and two of his children. The census states that he emigrated from the US into Canada in 1909. His religion is Methodist, and his birth date is listed as December of 1860. This is doubtful, since he was six months old on the 1860 census (above), a census that was taken in June of 1860.

Name RoleSex Age Birthplace Frank Greenup HeadMale 51USA Fanny GreenupWife Female 38USA Edith Greenup Dau. Female 16USA Ernest GreenupSonMale 14USA

[8]

According to Elise Greenup Jourdan's book "The Greenup Family", there were 10 children born to Elmira and Benjamin Franklin Greenup. One of the children, Leroy Frank Greenup was adopted by Frank's older sister sister, Julia, and took her last name, "Peck". Benjamin married a second time to FANNIE HEATH and had two additional children. Here is a list of the 12 children:

Emma May, b. 23 March 1883 in MN

George Edwin b. 2 Nov. 1884 in MN

Charles Benjamin b. 21 aug. 1886 in MN

William Henry b. 5 July 1888 in MN

Clara Jane b. 3 October 1890 in MN

Frances M. Grace b. 31 January 1893 in MN

Edith Belle b. 1 May 1895 in ND

Earnest Grant b. 14 March 1897 in ND

Lucy Ann b. 21 May 1899 in ND

Leroy Frank (became "Peck" after adoption) b. 14 February 1901 in ND

Benjamin Franklin Jr. b. 30 May 1908/9 in ND

Sybil Pansy b. 3 May 1913 in Canada [9]

Benjamin Franklin Greenup's Findagrave Memorial page, which can be viewed at https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/11799271/benjamin-franklin-greenup, states that he died on July 31, 1938, and is buried in Prairie Round Cemetery, Lucky Strike, Medicine Hat Census Division, Alberta, Canada.

A biography posted on the Findagrave memorial page says, in part:

He married Elmira M. Senff on 20 Apr 1882 in Cass Co., MN. They had 6 children in the Gull River-Motley, Cass Co., MN area before moving to Grand Prairie Twp., Barnes Co., ND, where they had 4 more children. Elmira died there on 6 Jun 1903 when she was only 36 years old. She was buried in Morton Cemetery just up the road from their farm. Frank remarried to Fannie Heath of KY on 27 Nov 1908 and they moved to Alberta, Canada where they had 2 children, Benjamin Franklin Greenup Jr. who died when he was about 4 yrs. old, and Sybil Pansy Greenup-Demuelenaere, who lives in Canada.

The biography states that Benjamin Franklin Greenup lived near his daughter Edith Belle Kingsbury in Alberta, Canada. It gives the following information about his other children: His oldest daughter, Emma May Hurd-Schroeder lived in Paso Robles, CA. Son George Edwin Greenup died in the 1920 flu epidemic in Lansford, North Dakota, as did his wife, Ethel. Another son, Charles Benjamin Greenup disappeared after the death of his mother, and was heard from only a couple of times after that. Son Wiliam Harry Greenup lived in Snohomish, Washington, and married three times. Daughter Clara Jane Greenup married Henry Chowen and lived in Prince Edward island, Canada. Daughter Frances Grace Greenup married William Harry Beach and lived in Carrington, ND. Ernest Grant Greenup and his wife Angeline lived in Ventura, CA. Lucy Ann Greenup married William Scott and lived in Everett, WA. The youngest son, LeRoy Greenup-Peck, who was less than three years old when his mother died, and who was raised by his aunt and uncle Israel and Julia (Greenup) Peck married Edna Graves and died in Newberg, OR. [10]

The following relatives' Findagrave memorial pages have links from Benjamin Franklin Greenup's memorial page.

Parents: Stephen Harlan Greenup (1821–1898); Elizabeth Ann Hoyt Greenup (1821–1903)

Spouse: Fannie Gertrude Keith Greenup (1873–1942, m. 1908)

Siblings: Hester Ann Greenup Beetem (1844–1928); Julia Ellen Greenup Peck (1845–1922); Wilbur Fisk Greenup (1851–1930); Lucy Greenup (1853–1867); William Allen Greenup (1856–1947); Edmond Grant Greenup (1867–1941)

Children: Edith Belle Greenup Kingsbury (1895–1953)[10]
